text.name: longdescription
text.text: The MSU-1 chip is a SNES enhancement chip created by Higan emulator creator byuu et al. MSU stands for "Media Streaming Unit 1". MSU-1 is a play on the GSU-1 "Graphics Support Unit 1" chip, a version of the Super FX chip. Offers 4GB data storage in a single stream for full-motion video & CD-quality sound.
